intro: Lateristachys halconensis, commonly known as the Halconensis mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its leafless stems and fleshy, disc-shaped bodies. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy berries. This species is native to parts of Central and South America, where it plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host trees.
